title: Legendre's conjecture
summary: Legendre's conjecture, proposed by Adrien-Marie Legendre, states that there is a prime number between n 2 {\displaystyle n^{2}} and ( n + 1 ) 2 {\displaystyle (n+1)^{2}} for every positive integer n {\displaystyle n} .  The conjecture is one of Landau's problems (1912) on prime numbers; as of 2022, the conjecture has neither been proved nor disproved.
